snippet: The uneven nature of the recovery — between a group of strong countries in the north and a larger swath of weak nations in the southern rim — has made it difficult for the overall economy to gain momentum.
abstract: Data released by European statistics agency Eurostat shows that growth in euro zone rose 0.2 percent in first quarter, which translates to annual growth rate of 0.8 percent; while data represents fourth straight quarter of expansion, it is half what economists expected; growth is so feeble that it could be years before Europe recovers.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani in Rome contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The uneven nature of the recovery — between a group of strong countries in the north and a larger swath of weak nations in the southern rim — has made it difficult for the overall economy to gain momentum.

headline.main: Full Recovery Still Years Away for Many in Euro Zone
